Description: Two fragments from a woollen, weft-faced plain weave tunic; a) is from the central area below the neck, b) from the hem area, centre, front or back; Mainly undyed, cream wool, with two tapestry (single warp threads) bands / clavi in dark blue and cream wool and some bleached linen; Design of culring stems enclosing animals and danceing human figures, design of dotted cusps, soumak outlining, twining, and eight pointed star motifs (centre of star in a basket effect made by overlapping float wrapped brocading; Much darned and patched with another textile (c); Warp: S spun, c.11 tpc; Weft: wool and linen, S spun, c.24 tpc of main weft, c.50 tpc tapestry weft; Sewing: couching darning and running stitch and overcasting attaching patches in S spun, Z ply wool thread; Edges: remains of selvedge with a fringe on b), otherwise edges raged; c): coarsely woven, undyed, cream wool used as two patches on back of each fragment (i and ii), extended plain weave (paired warp), warp: S spun/c.5 tpc, weft: S spun/c.20 tpc, edges cut and turned under or raged
Curator's comments: Previous location Cupboard 64, brown box; Much of damage dates to before burial; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (2/11/1989)
Condition: Poor; Unknown date stuck to sticky net
